item.title: Notability 2022-11-10 Update
item.description: Today is 2022-11-10, 2 days ago Notability updated a new version (Version 11.8) involves a high-demanding feature – Night version. Programmers and researchers spend a lot of time on screens, especially for people use iPad to take notes. Staring at the screen for a long time is harmful, whereas using a dark background and reduce the harmness. Personally, I use PDF Expert as my primary PDF viewer, and the reason is simply it have the so-called “dark mode” option.

item.title: Usage of trapz
item.description: trapz is the Trapezoidal numerical integration. Normally the usage will be x = linspace(0,1,100); y = x.^2; I = trapz(x,y) This will approximate the integral $$ \tag{1} \int_0^1 x^2~\mathrm{d}x $$ One less known usage There is one usage of trapz can cause problem. Suppose we want to approximate the same integral $(1)$ again, however instead of the code above, we mistype and write x = linspace(0,1,100); y = x.^2; I = trapz(y); This can happen if the code is long and the expression is complicated.

item.title: MATLAB Space
item.description: vertcat When we concentrate two different vectors in MATLAB, for example a = [1,2,3,4]; b = [3,4,5]; Only [a,b] is valid, [a;b] is not valid, the output is the following >> [a,b] ans = 1 2 3 4 3 4 5 >> [a;b] Error using vertcat Dimensions of arrays being concatenated are not consistent. Interesting Example Here is an interesting example from my friend’s homework, >> f = -3 * 1 -3*(-2); g = 1 + 1 + 1 +1; k = [f;g] k = 3 4 Seems trivial, isn’t it?
